H0.text: The water cycle is a process that occurs as a result of the rotation of Earth about its own axis.

H1.text: Seasons of the year occur as a result of the rotation of Earth about its own axis.

H2.text: Sunrises and sunsets occur as a result of the Earthâ€™s rotation about its own axis.

H3.text: Global climate changes occur as a result of the rotation of Earth about its own axis.

A4.text: Earth rotates once in about 24 hours with respect to the Sun

A5.text: When these masses are reduced, the poles rebound from the loss of weight, and Earth becomes more spherical, which has the effect of bringing mass closer to its centre of gravity. Conservation of angular momentum dictates that a mass distributed more closely around its centre of gravity spins faster.
